Barbados: English Captain Simon Gordon may have first made a brief landing on Barbados.  The Portuguese abandon Barbados.
Belgium: First Flemish newspaper, Nieuwe Tijdinghen, begins regular publication. Chamber of Rhetoric De Peoene hosts a rhetoric competition in Mechelen.
China:
The Wanli Emperor died.
The Wanli Emperor's son the Taichang Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty.
The Taichang Emperor died.
The Taichang Emperor's young son the Tianqi Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty.
Indinesia:
Almost the entire native population of Banda Islands was deported, driven away, starved to death or killed in an attempt to replace them with Dutch colonial slave labour.
Diplomatic agreements in Europe commence a three-year period of cooperation between the Dutch and the English over the spice trade.
Philippine: Colegio de San Juan de Letran established as the Colegio de Huerfanos de San Pedro y San Pablo.
